h2. Known issues
The fix for this issue adds further diagnostics that will (in much more limited circumstances) trigger more null pointer exceptions that will abort synchronisation. These are described in CONF-23102, and fixed in Confluence 3.5.12 or higher. For this reason, *the recommended fix is to upgrade to 3.5.12 or higher*.

h2. Patch

Attached to CONF-22342 is an updated version of [atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2 jar|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/48380/atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2-1.2.9-m3.jar], to patch this issue. When patched, transactions will now correctly rollback, and log the records that were in error.

It is known to work in Confluence 3.5.4 and 3.5.5, and might work in earlier versions, but these have not been tested, nor should they require it unless they are patching CONF-22342. It is not needed in Confluence 3.5.6, as that version already contains this fix.

h3. Installation
To install the patch:
# Stop Confluence
# Move the old atlassian-embedded-crowd-hibernate2 jar out of {{<confluence install dir>/confluence/WEB-INF/lib}}
# Copy the new jar into the same directory
# Start Confluence
fields.summary: Null pointer when detecting duplicate memberships while synchronising

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22620].
  {panel}

During implementation of the flash embedding for the multimedia macro, I introduced some functionality to extract the width and height of the flash file, and automatically render it to that height. This is "nice to have" functionality that was not in the original scope, and was added as it was a quickwin.

This had the main drawback for having to read the initial contents of the attachment for each page render. It's been removed for the moment, and users will need to manually enter the width and height.

A few alternatives to prevent this overhead include:

* Get the dimensions when selecting the attachment in the browser (complicates the UI code)
* Add meta-data to attachments:
   ** Store in lucene (no db changes, or migration tasks). Downside is delay in this information being available until the next index (up to 1 minute). This is probably a small issue as adding attachments to the current page under edit is not obvious (but can be done).
   ** Store as addition data in the database against an attachment (e.g. key/value pairs). May slow down upload, as extraction of metadata will occur at upload. Metadata will be immediately available.
   ** Other benefits include potential to extract other meta-data which may be searchable (e.g. mp3 tags, word document keywords, etc).

The preferred option is to add meta-data to attachments. The particular method for storing this is to be determined.

Daniel is already planning on adding metadata information for attachments as part of a 20% project. So this can be revisited when the outcome of that project is complete.
fields.summary: Automatically determine size of multimedia content and populate the width and height in the macro browser.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22604].
  {panel}

This story is derived from CONFDEV-3906.

*Scenario*
# Create a page in a space that has restrictions
# Set the page restrictions to be more open than the space restrictions (e.g. set it so all users can edit the page, but in the space permissions only you can edit pages in that space)
# The page restrictions you have set that are wider than the space restrictions, and so will not apply

The page-level restrictions allow the page to be _more_ restricted than the space. The page cannot be made _less_ restricted than the space. This is expected behaviour. However, it would be a better user experience if *the user is notified that they are setting page restrictions that are wider than their space restrictions*.
fields.summary: As a user, I want notification if I set page permissions that are more open than my space permissions

fields.description:
Step 1 - Open a page in Confluence
Step 2 - Click on the button "Edit". The editing page will be opened. The Tab "Rich Text" is active.
Step 3 - Click on the Tab "Wiki Markup" . The wheel is rotating. The Tab will be never opened.
Same happens if we click on the  tab "Preview".

In this case we cannot switch to "Rich Text" or "Preview"...
This issue occurs regardless of using HTTP or HTTPS, as well as when we using direct access or proxy.

fields.description: DB2 does not allow unique constraints on columns that allow nulls. This means that code that currently relies on ConstraintViolationExceptions preventing duplicates being added to cwd_membership won't work, since the exception will never be thrown. We need to fix the code to ensure that we never try to add duplicate memberships to the DB, or that we can recover gracefully from this happening in all cases.
fields.summary: Duplicate memberships can prevent synchronisation from working on DB2
Write documentation for new gadget whitelist

fields.description:
If a new (to Confluence) user logs in during a directory synchronisation, the synchronisation will detect duplicate users or memberships, and all users/memberships that would have been added in the same batch are dropped. For regular LDAP, this problem will resolve itself on the next synchronisation attempt. However, for Active Directory, most synchronisations are incremental, so they won't be discovered until the next full synchronisation is run. Right now, the only way to trigger a full synchronisation for Active Directory is by restarting Confluence.

This should be fixed so that the batch processor will fall back correctly to processing individual records when a batch fails, so that only the actual duplicates are rejected.
fields.summary: Active Directory user/membership updates lost due to duplicate entries until restart

fields.description:
A way to migrate users from old user management tables to a DELEGATED directory to allow upgrades of systems connected with Large LDAPs that fail during the upgrade. 
 
When the upgrade for customer with Large LDAPS is not possible?
If the previus version use atlassian-user (hibernate) LDAP and it is a large LDAP -> It fail because the type of directory created will be CONNECTOR and it tries to syncronize during upgrade.
  
What would be a quick patch solution for now?
1) we not copy atlassian-user.xml file over the new installation during the upgrade.
2) new Confluence will think there is no LDAP and will simply copy over the old user/group related tables (external_*), not move the data to the new cwd_* tables unless for the Internal Confluence users.
3) After the upgrade is sucessfull, we will be able to log on with a Internal Confluence admin user and create a new DELEGATED directory
4) we should have an option to run a script to  move of all data from deprecated tables to the DELEGATED LDAP directory (users, group and memberships)
fields.summary: script to migrate users from old user management tables to a DELEGATED directory

fields.description:

I'm filing this as a bug because when Confluence interfaces with other systems,  it treats MSG files as "application/octet-stream" which is incorrect.
fields.summary: Add Outlook MSG to mime.types

fields.description:
*Allow administrators to create both global and space variables.*
For Example:
* Space Administrator creates a variable called currentversion and sets it to 3.5, users can then put %currentversion% into their pages to show that variable.
* Confluence Administrator creates a variable called messageoftheday and sets it to "Live long and prosper". Users can put %messageoftheday% wherever they want.
* Space Administrator creates a variable in their space called todayslunch and sets it to "Pizza". Other users can call that variable from that space by using %food|todayslunch%

*Allow users to call built in variables*
For Example:
* %_pagename% to get the current pagename.
* %_spacename% to get the current spacename.
* %_createdby% to get the user who created the page.

*Allow macros to use those variables*
For Example:
* You want to list all pages that have the label %_pagename% in another space. In the labellist macro you can use system, global and space variables instead of writing down labels. Perfect when using templates.

*Allow users and page templates to put variables into labels*
For Example:
* Set a label to %_createdby%. Then you can list all pages created by some user.
fields.summary: Implement system variables into confluence/spaces/pages so macros and other features can call them.

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site request forgery (XSRF) vulnerability which may affect Confluence instances in a public environment. The XSRF vulnerability is exposed in the Confluence Social Bookmarking plugin. Note that the Social Bookmarking plugin is disabled by default. If you do not have this plugin enabled, your site will not be affected.

An attacker might take advantage of the vulnerability to trick users into unintentionally submitting malicious data. An XSRF attack works by exploiting the trust that a site has for the user. If a user is logged into Confluence and an attacker tricks their browser into making a request to a Confluence URL, then the task is performed as the logged in user.

You can read more about XSRF attacks at cgisecurity and other places on the web:
http://www.cgisecurity.com/csrf-faq.html

Please refer to the security advisory for details of the vulnerability, risk assessment and mitigation strategies:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/aAI5Dg

The page also includes instructions for upgrading the plugin.
fields.summary: XSRF vulnerability in the Social Bookmarking plugin

fields.description: the custom feed builder option does not really work as it needs login every time.  So we are not able to use the custom feed created by it. There should option to create public feed which do not need authentication.
fields.summary: custom rss feed does not work

fields.description:
Members of the special {{confluence-administrators}} group have access to all content on the site, however they should not see restricted content in search results or get notifications about changes on restricted pages.

There is a bug in the permission check for notifications about "contained" objects (comments and attachments) that result in the isSuperuser() check applying when these notifications are triggered by a space or network watch. This means members of confluence-administrators are emailed information that they _are_ allowed to see, but should not be notified about.

This was introduced by my changes around super-user checking in CONF-18073, in Confluence 3.5.
fields.summary: Members of confluence-administrators receive notifications for comments and attachments on restricted pages
Build and release 3.5.5

fields.description:
There's a Bandana cache that caches everything which is sent in and out of Bandana, including mutable objects like the global Settings object.

We should consider the following:

* adding some guidance that only immutable objects should be passed to Bandana
* changing the settings managers to use immutable settings objects
* other stuff?
fields.summary: Bandana cache (PluginSettings) stores mutable objects

fields.description:
When testing Activity Streams, new blog posts were showing up with timestamps that were way off. I found that when Streams is querying content from Confluence, every com.atlassian.confluence.pages.BlogPost object has a creationDate property with no time (i.e. the date is correct but the time is 00:00:00). The lastModificationDate property has the correct time, so we can probably work around this in Streams by just using lastModificationDate instead of creationDate for new blog posts.

This might be related to CONF-17872 - that issue was resolved as "not a bug" on the theory that it had to do with different server time vs. user time, but that can't be true in this case because I'm running locally. Also might be related to CONF-21910.
fields.summary: Blog post creation date is used as a publish date: it is different to the actual creation time and sometimes stored as midnight

fields.description:
1.  login to Confluence as an Admin
2.  Create a user macro {current_user}:
{code}
#if ($param0 == "name")#**#$action.remoteUser.displayName#else#**#$action.remoteUser.name#end
{code}

3. Add a new page, use the wiki markup editor to enter this body
* Show me the Google Love: \[http://www.google.com/search?q={current_user}]

4.  Save page
5.  Verify that the page contains a link, and that it searches for the current userid.
6.  Edit page and select RTE
7.  save page
8.  Verify that the {current_user} macro has *NOT* been escaped with slashes, breaking the link
fields.summary: RTE escapes macro embedded in Link

fields.description:
In this [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Setting+the+JAVA_HOME+Variable+in+Windows]:
{quote}
If you already know the installation path for the Java Development Kit, go to Stage 2 below. Otherwise, find the installation path by following these instructions:

   1. Unless you changed the installation path for the Java Development Kit during installation, it will be in a directory under C:\Program Files\Java. Using Explorer, open the directory C:\Program Files\Java.
   2. Inside that path will be one or more subdirectories such as jdk1.6.0_17. If you have just installed the Java Development Kit, it will be installed to the newest directory, which you can find by sorting by date. For example, it may be installed in C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_17. This is the installation path.
{quote}
The example of the JAVA path has a space but there isn't any example for using path with space. Please add an example of using the path with "Progra~1" in the JAVA HOME.
fields.summary: JAVA HOME shouldn't have space

fields.summary: Confluence share page feature tries to autocomplete username to LDAP users who no longer exist

fields.description:

{noformat}
GET /rest/prototype/1/i18n/com.atlassian.confluence.keyboardshortcuts?locale=en_GB HTTP/1.1.
Host: hidden

HTTP/1.1 200 OK.
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1.
Cache-Control: .
Pragma: .
Expires: .
Last-Modified: Sat, 14 May 2011 16:31:44 GMT.
ETag: "1305390704000".
Content-Type: application/json.
Transfer-Encoding: chunked.

Subsequent requests for the same resource give the response:

Host: hidden
If-None-Match: "1305390704000".

HTTP/1.1 304 Not Modified.
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1.
X-Seraph-LoginReason: OK.
Cache-Control: .
Pragma: .
Expires: .
Last-Modified: Sat, 14 May 2011 16:31:44 GMT.
ETag: "1305390704000".
Date: Wed, 18 May 2011 00:20:10 GMT.
{noformat}

The Cache-Control, Pragma and Expires headers should instead be set to something usable by callers, preferably to the long term public caching values.
fields.summary: i18n rest responses have incorrect cache headers

fields.description:
h3.Feature
It would be great if Confluence could have a configurable limit on the number of comments shown initially upon page load, with a clickable control that would show the remainder of the comments.This initial amount would be set per page or per space, with a global default also settable, from the admin section 

This would be achieved in the admin Section where the admin could select the maximum number of posts, per issue, user or amount.

h3.Fix
None yet.

h3.Workaround
Unfortunately there is no workaround for this feature
fields.summary: Limit the number of comments in an issue
Multimedia macro should determine media dimensions from file

Hi,

I think it would be nice to have an upgrade matrix or table that tells in one glance about the intermediate version of confluence that a user needs to upgrade to. At support, we get quite a lot of questions about it and the customers are most of the times confused about it.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22544].
  {panel}

On a site that allows anonymous access to several pages, clicking on a restricted page will redirect you to a login page. In certain circumstances, after login the user will be redirected to their preferred homepage.action, rather than the page. This can occur when the page permissions prevent viewing the page, but space permissions would normally allow it.

If the space prevents access, the redirect will complete normally.

This can only occur where there is a reverse proxy server in front of the servlet container running Confluence, and Confluence is configured with a base URL that points to the proxy server, rather than Confluence's own server.

h3. Diagnosis
This issue can be diagnosed by
# Enabling debug logging on the following packages:
{noformat}
com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions
com.atlassian.seraph
{noformat}
# When not logged in, browsing to a page known to cause the issue
# Inspecting the atlassian-confluence.log and noting that PageNotPermittedAction invokes setPage immediately before BaseLoginFilter attempts login for a URL with the wrong prefix
# Repeating for a page known not to cause the issue, and noting no similar pattern in the logs.

h3. Workaround
Set the Confluence base URL to be its own URL - this will resolve this issue, but may still cause other issues in javascript. Test with care.
fields.summary: Redirect after login for certain pages can be discarded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22542].
  {panel}

Confluence currently does not allow for an upgrade process that fits with our requirements of an enterprise system that is business critical.

We can't run the upgrade process on the live systemfor a number of reasons.

As a result in our enterprise environments it is best practice to preform updates in a development environment. Preform Testing regime, work out the bugs. When statisfied that the system can be upgraded, the production environment is then frozen or taken off-line and the upgrade is repreformed on the production environment with "current" content.

Our process is currently/The method that now seems preferable is to us is:

 

1.       Place a freeze on any new plugins (should be frozen anyway).

2.       Create a new server with a fresh install of the *current* version of confluence. This creates a clean environment.

3.       Copy to that the database and data directory from the production machine.

4.       Test it to ensure the copying occurred correctly.  

5.       Perform the in place upgrade, apply patches and upgrade plugins. 

6.       Perform thorough user testing. 

7.       Make notes of any modifications and fixes required.

8.       Trash the test system (maybe overkill).

9.       Place a content freeze on the current Confluence.

10.   Repeat steps 2 .. 5

11.   Apply noted modifications and fixes.

12.   Test the modifications and any new content

13.   Switch to the new server

14.   Release the content freeze


As a rough estimate, this process inclusive of user testing will take at least 6 weeks. and has a relativily long period of the system either being offline or content frozen for 2-3day. Which is almost impossible given the current use by business units.

---------------------------------------------
We need a system that enable the downtime to be minimal...and doesn't involve updating a live system...exposing it to undue risk, as it is a critical system.

Originally we were planning to create a completely fresh install of the latest version of confluence on a new VM then importing the data via the backup/restore function built into Confluence. 

The purpose of this strategy was to ensure we always had the latest software in a 'clean' environment. Any cruft such as cached content, old plugins and other leftover files are not brought into the new environment and all the servers software is at the latest secure iteration.

Lastly it implies minimum content freeze time and downtime. This is because once the new environment is up and tested all that is required to make it live is to make a new backup of the current install and then import it into the new instance. Add to that some minor testing to ensure the import occurred correctly and we can enable the new server. 

there was a concern that exporting the data from the old version of confluence may fail. Apparently if there are too many attachments the system can hang. According to one bug report if data and attachments exceed 1.9GB it will fail. Although it's the exporting that fails, our actual concern is that the import may fail silently. If we lost a swathe of attachments we may not know for months if at all. 

As a result this method is not advisable! The problem of exporting has not been resolved and as the issue is now almost 3 years old. It is also listed as "not advisable" in the 3.5 upgrade notes.
----------------------------------------
The recommended way to upgrade is to do an "in place" upgrade using a clone of the existing site, upgrading, testing and releasing to production. "In place" refers to the fact you are overwriting the existing files and then allowing the application to perform the upgrade steps when first started.  

This method negates the advantages I spoke of earlier. Particularly with respect to a clean server environment. 

As a result we'd request that Atlassian give consideration to improving the 1)process for updating the application to align with best practice for critical enterprise systems and minimise downtown 2) improve documentation around upgrade including testing procedures.
fields.summary: Improve Upgrade Process - Confluence

fields.description:
Under MySQL, users and groups can wind up with duplicate membership entries in the cwd_membership table. The existing constraint:
{code:sql}
alter table cwd_membership add constraint cwd_unique_membership unique (parent_id, child_group_id, child_user_id)
{code}
has no effect thanks to child_group_id and child_user_id both allowing nulls. We need to apply a fix similar to the fix we did for the content permissions unique constraints fix, and apply different unique constraints in environments where nulls are ignored (mysql, postgres) vs nulls are distinct values too (oracle, sql server) vs illegal (db2).

h2. Patch

Attached is [^CONF-22541-patch-v2.zip], which will repair any duplicate memberships in MySQL, and add corrected constraints to the cwd_membership table. The patch is compatible with Confluence 3.5.1 - 3.5.5. Confluence 3.5.6 contains this fix, so does not require the patch. Due to changes in upgrade infrastructure between Confluence 3.5 and 3.5.1, the patch is not backwards compatible with Confluence 3.5.

h3. Contents
The patch contains 15 files in 3 directories:
 * confluence/WEB-INF
   ** com/atlassian/confluence/upgrade/upgradetask
     *** AbstractConstraintCreationUpgradeTask.class
     *** 7x ContentPermissionConstraintsUpgradeTask classes
     *** 4x EmbeddedCrowdSchemaUpgradeTask classes
   ** com/atlassian/crowd/embedded/hibernate2
     *** 2x additional_constraints properties files
 * confluence/admin
   ** fixcwdmemberships.jsp


h3. Installation
To install the patch:
# stop Confluence
# extract the zip to the top level of your {{<confluence install dir>}}. This will create the required directories under confluence/WEB-INF for the patched files.
# start Confluence
# Log in as a confluence administrator, and navigate to {{<confluence base url>/admin/fixcwdmemberships.jsp}}, and follow the prompts

When running the jsp on a confluence 3.5.x instance that has already run any 3.5.x upgrade tasks, this patch will cause log messages containing messages such as {code:none}Constraint cwd_group_name_dir_id already exists{code} or {code:none}Could not create unique constraint ... Duplicate key name 'cwd_group_name_dir_id'{code} to appear in the logs. These are harmless, and can be safely ignored.
fields.summary: Unique membership constraints ignored on MySQL

fields.description:
After a recent local outage (due to high GC from high memory usage under load), I found that many threads were competing to load SpacePermissions from hibernate during DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermissionViaGroups.  For example (but hasPermissionViaGroups is the highest line common to most threads):

{noformat}
"http-9080-6" daemon prio=10 tid=0x0aecf400 nid=0x3605 waiting for monitor entry [0x4105b000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)
	at net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache.get(ReadWriteCache.java:69)
	- waiting to lock <0x54f2a7d0> (a net.sf.hibernate.cache.ReadWriteCache)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.hibernate.ConfluenceCacheStrategy.get(ConfluenceCacheStrategy.java:52)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.doLoad(SessionImpl.java:2120)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.doLoadByClass(SessionImpl.java:1999)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.internalLoad(SessionImpl.java:1961)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.ManyToOneType.resolveIdentifier(ManyToOneType.java:69)
	at net.sf.hibernate.type.ManyToOneType.assemble(ManyToOneType.java:108)
	at net.sf.hibernate.cache.StandardQueryCache.get(StandardQueryCache.java:79)
	at net.sf.hibernate.loader.Loader.list(Loader.java:1045)
	at net.sf.hibernate.hql.QueryTranslator.list(QueryTranslator.java:854)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.SessionImpl.find(SessionImpl.java:1552)
	at net.sf.hibernate.impl.QueryImpl.list(QueryImpl.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao$5.doInHibernate(HibernateObjectDao.java:385)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)
	at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.executeFind(HibernateTemplate.java:341)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findNamedQueryStringParams(HibernateObjectDao.java:352)
	at com.atlassian.hibernate.HibernateObjectDao.findNamedQuery(HibernateObjectDao.java:272)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.persistence.dao.hibernate.HibernateSpacePermissionDao.findAllGlobalPermissions(HibernateSpacePermissionDao.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermissionViaGroups(DefaultSpacePermissionManager.java:443)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultSpacePermissionManager.canUseConfluence(DefaultSpacePermissionManager.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.CachingSpacePermissionManager.canUseConfluence(CachingSpacePermissionManager.java:228)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultSpacePermissionManager.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.CachingSpacePermissionManager.hasPermission(CachingSpacePermissionManager.java:212)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.security.DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermission(DefaultSpacePermissionManager.java:194)
{noformat}

There are numerous ways to fix this but a risk free way is to tighten the queries performed by hasPermissionViaGroups.
Currently it looks up either all global permissions or all space permissions every time it is called.  It actually only needs the permissions for groups and only those for a specific permission type.
fields.summary: Improve performance of DefaultSpacePermissionManager.hasPermissionViaGroups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22536].
  {panel}

When running the following command:
{noformat}curl --basic -u my.user -H "Accept: application/json"  https://xxx.com/rest/prototype/1/content/xxx?expand=children{noformat}
I get the following JSON response which contains mixed protocols:
{noformat}
 u'link': [   {   u'href': u'https://xxx.com/display/xxx/xxx',
                     u'rel': u'alternate',
                     u'type': u'text/html'},
                 {   u'href': u'https://xxx.com/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=xxx',
                     u'rel': u'alternate',
                     u'type': u'applicaton/pdf'},
                 {   u'href': u'http://xxx.com/rest/prototype/1/content/xxx',
                     u'rel': u'self'}],
{noformat}

The first two URLs returned in the response are correctly using https, but the last URL is using an http URL. This is because the 'self' URL uses a different method of absolute URL construction to the others in this response.

This situation occurs when the configured base URL differs from the request URL that Confluence has received. The {{self}} URL is constructed using the request URL, whereas the {{alternate}} URLs are constructed with the configured base URL.

In the example above, the Tomcat instance is getting proxied requests over HTTP, but the configured base URL is HTTPS.
fields.summary: Use consistent method of constructing absolute URLs in content resources in REST API
Prevent custom images appearing blurry in PDF export

fields.description:
When calling a REST resource like http://localhost:8080/confluence/rest/prototype/1/search.json?search=name&query=tese&spaceKey=&max-results=10 the max-results is ignored.

doContentNameSearch and doSiteSearch in SearchService accept 'pageSize', which can be used as a workaround, but this isn't made clear in the published Javadoc.

The three search variants - name, site and user - should have the same pagination and maximum-results API and implementation.
fields.summary: SearchService should respect 'max-results' parameter

fields.description:
On Confluence Admin > Manage Users > Show all users, if you hover over a local user, a special modal div with class {{ajs-cotent-hover}} will load and display the name, avatar, and email address for the user. However, if you hover over a user retrieved from LDAP the {{.ajs-cotent-hover .content}} DOM object has no children, thus no content loads, but {{.ajs-cotent-hover div#content-hover-shadow}} still loads, showing a transparent shadow around the non-existent content modal box. See screenshots attached.

Tested on Connie 3.5.2 and 3.5.4 in both FF and Safari.
fields.summary: ajs-content-hover fails to load content for LDAP users on Confluence Admin > Manage Users

fields.description:
One of our users encountered the following error message, which contains a typo (adminstrator):

"You cannot change the password for this user via Confluence. Please contact your system adminstrator."

This should read:

"You cannot change the password for this user via Confluence. Please contact your system administrator."

Please let me know if any further detail is required to enable this bug to be resolved.
fields.summary: Typo in error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22521].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

# Set up Crowd
# Add "confluence" as an application in Crowd
# Set up Confluence with a remote crowd directory pointing at Crowd
# Go to User Directories
# Click "synchronise" and wait until synchronisation finishes. Look at Crowd log to make sure something is happening.
# Click "synchronise" again and look at the Crowd log.

*Expected result:*
Synchronisation request should hit Crowd

*Actual result:*
No request hits Crowd

Perhaps the best way of seeing whether the request even hits Crowd is to now remove the "confluence" application from Crowd. When you refresh the User Directory page and click "synchronise" you should see in the Crowd logs something like: "Application 'confluence' failed authentication".

*Workaround*
The workaround is to ensure that you always refresh the page before hitting "synchronise".
fields.summary: Synchronising a directory twice on the same page fails the second time

fields.description:
Customers with large LDAP directory will hit into sync issue in Confluence 3.5.x.

The current recommendation is to create a more specific LDAP search filter, failing that we recommend using Delegated LDAP directory.

It is unfortunately not easy for these customers to just use Delegated LDAP, primarily because their LDAP users will lose their original group membership (eg. LDAP groups and other local groups). These need to be created manually by the admin.

We should create an option to allow these customers to move their user management to Delegated LDAP after upgrade.

Kind of a combination of CONF-22090 and CONF-22295. And perhaps make the jsp smarter so it can automatically create LDAP groups in the delegated directory (by scouring the {{spacepermissions}} table)?
fields.summary: Allow migration to the Delegated LDAP directory during upgrade

fields.description:
h3.Problem
Steps to reproduce:
# At AD, rename a user.
# Try to re-sync the directory, note that both usernames (the old and the new username) are showed at *Manage Users* link.
# The new username didn't inherit the groups membership, the old username kept the group membership, but *none of them can log in Confluence*.

*Note:* Even trying to resynchronize the directory many times and flush cache statistics (Confluence Admin > Cache Statistics > Flush All), don't seems to solve the problem. 
h3.Fix

There is none yet.

h3.Workaround
# At *User Directories* link, disable the directory, enable it again, and re-sync.
# Check the users at *Manage Users* link, it should now show only the right username, with the right group membership.

Note there are cases where just disabling, enabling and syncing again *does not* resolve the issue. In those cases:
* Database table may show 2 different users (due to rename) with the same external_id:
{code}
SELECT * FROM cwd_user WHERE external_id in  (SELECT external_id FROM cwd_user GROUP BY external_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1);
{code}

Wokraround:
# Disable the current user directory
# Create a new user directory with the *exact same configuration* as it was in the old directory
# Sync the new directory and the users should be able to login and have the correct information.
fields.summary: After change an username in Active Directory and resynchronize, there are two accounts showing in Confluence (the old and the new username).

fields.description:
Reading [https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/2010/08/04/Autocomplete+Components+for+Confluence], it seems to me data-max should limit the number of search results returned.

From my findings, it seems that data-max is respected all the way till the AJAX call for content names (the value of the data-max attribute gets sent as a request parameter named "data-max"). However, the REST service ignores the parameter specified by the AJAX request.

https://svn.atlassian.com/svn/private/atlassian/confluence/trunk/confluence-rest/confluence-rest-plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/confluence/plugins/rest/resources/SearchService.java

Looks like the method that handles content name searches isn't expecting a "data-max" query parameter?
fields.summary: Content autocomplete component ignores data-max

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22500].
  {panel}

Please consider exposing the ability to purge users:
* watches
* drafts

Accounts can get orphaned, and we currently only know there's an issue when a watch email bounces.  Which requires us to impersonate the user in order to remove their watches and drafts.
fields.summary: Confluence Admin: Manage Users - Ability to Purge Watches, Drafts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22499].
  {panel}

We've recently become aware that when a user removes/deletes a page, Confluence performs a "soft" delete - where the content is flagged so it's still in the database/etc but not visible to any users.  To actually delete pages, we need to use the Trash page via the Space Admin on a per Space basis.

Please consider:
* Exposing the ability to delete more than one page at a time
* Exposing the ability to view the deleted page content, so we can view the content without having to restore the page (causing grief with users who're using the space at that time, besides potential page name collisions)
* Listing information relating to who deleted the page and when - it would be quite helpful to know who made the decision (they might no longer be involved), and when the action was performed.
* A page in the Admin console to survey the deleted pages for purging across Spaces - it gets really tedious to hop from one space to another
fields.summary: Confluence Space Admin: Trash screen improvements

fields.description:

*\[installation\]* At the moment we are using the "standalone"

And obviously FOO displays on the page. I want to get the square brackets on the page content, as it is my way of marking the paragragh.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-22495].
{panel}
We have an issue here with confluence that prevent us to adopt it fully in our company .

In the French language, we use accents, such as é,à,é,etc.. and we need Confluence to ignore those accents for searchs, like google does.

For instance the search text: "majore", should give us pages with "majoré" or "majore" or "majorè"

It would be very useful if we could configure the search feature to be able to ignore accents.

Languages that should ignore accents for searches are:
 * English (for loanwords, and also cover other European languages not supported in Confluence indexing)
 * French
 * Spanish
 * Catalan (not supported in Confluence indexing)
 * Portuguese (currently only Brazilian Portuguese is supported in Confluence indexing)
fields.summary: Allow search feature to ignore accent

fields.description:
In CONF-22295, we created a jsp to cater upgrade from instances that used OSUser management and LDAP.

Unfortunately the script also migrated users that are meant to stay local to the "Delegated LDAP Directory". These users are not able to login as a result despite that they exist in CWD_USER table and appear valid.

We need to:
- Either make these kind of users able to login while in the Delegated Directory
- Or move them to Internal Directory automatically (see CONF-22297): Essentially we should make the upgrade task smart enough to identify which users are valid LDAP users; it needs to connect to the LDAP server and verify them then move the users who do not exist in LDAP to the Internal directory so they can login.
fields.summary: Users (from OSUser management) meant to be internal are migrated to Delegated Directory and no longer able to login

\\

# Click on any other link as long as you are navigate away from Dashboard.
# Go back to the Dashboard by clicking the Dashboard link at the upper left corner.

The collapse and expand is remembered in Confluence 3.4.9.

fields.description:
h3.Problem
WYSIWYG Should support 100% what we are seeing, since this is actually "what you see is what you get" this should be addressed as a bug.

Example Perl regEx::
{code}(.*)_(.*){code}
When to obtain the code above you have to use:
{code}(.\*)_(.\*){code}

Cannot be used even if you escape the characters, because once you save it, it loses the escape and renders poorly once it has been resaved.

h3.Fix
None Yet

h3.Workaround
Unfortunately to use \{code\}
fields.summary: Markup of "\*" is being corrupted when Edited in Rich Text

{noformat}
Import load page is keep on running and "Time Elapsed" and "Time Remaining" information are still counting which made some user believed import process are still running.

!importprocess.png|thumbnail!

It would be great if user interface would inform the user that import has failed, it would be even better if the ERROR thrown are inform in detail so that administrator could troubleshoot it.

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Preferably build a fresh instance with default allocated memory
# Import a huge size XML backup (to get OutOfMemory)
# Execute the import and wait
fields.summary: No ERROR message shown by user interface when XML import failed due to OutOfMemory
Derefer outgoing hyperlinks

fields.description:
When rendering certain content, the PDF Exporter will get confused as to how much progress it has made, and will show over 100% progress as it converts the intermediate HTML into a PDF. As soon as progress goes past 100%, the long running task display stops refreshing, preventing it from ever showing the final completion/failure message.

h3. Workaround
Browsing away from the page and using the browser's back button works in Firefox to trick the final task status to render.
fields.summary: PDF space export shows over 100% progress, download link is never rendered

fields.description: CONF-22374 introduced some checks to make sure incorrect permission data wasn't stored in Oracle and SQL Server, but resulted in the inability to delete a user or group with permissions on multiple pages in some specific situations.
fields.summary: Users and groups with multiple page permissions cannot be deleted on Oracle and SQL Server

fields.description:
This vulnerability affects all versions from 3.5 and above.

We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence settings editing action.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:

    * cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
    * The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/aAI5Dg
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in doeditmysettings.action
Attaching multiple files at once

fields.description:
The embedded Crowd integration mandates a Base DN in an LDAP Directory, but this was not the case for previous versions. As such, this prevents a customer to upgrade to Confluence 3.5.x, because their LDAP directory (100,000+ persons) does not use a base DN. Also, assuming that users and groups records always share the same base DN is an issue as well (this would not work either for this customer). Both limitations need to be removed from Confluence, i.e. there should be two *optional* base DN for users and groups searches.

Note: this is similar to CWD-1971 (and present, I guess, because this is Crowd embedded).
fields.summary: Support empty base DN definitions in a User Directory

fields.description:
When the I added one of our active directory groups the user count the LDAP timed out and gave the wrong number of users, actually 111 - there are more than that.  I removed that user group from the by editing permissions and rebooted the server.  Confluence came up but now it is reporting only 10 users and it there are actually 13.  We have a 50 user license

aused by: javax.naming.NamingException: LDAP response read timed out, timeout used:60000ms.
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.Connection.readReply(Connection.java:448)
	at com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapClient.ldapBind(LdapClient.java:340)
